page.title: 07DAIRSIE SHOP AND POST OFFICE
page.content: The Dairsie shop is on the main road between Cupar and St.Andrews. The shop is run by Mr.Nicol and his mother. It has been here for ten years since Mr.Nicols father built it. They have two assistants Mrs.Ednie and Mrs. Ainslie. The shope sells groceries, fruit and vegetables. There is also a Post Office in the shop where pensions and family allowances are available. Mr. Nicol owns a mobile van that goes all round Dairsie selling groceries and cakes. Mr.Connell drives the van and also serves customers. He gets cakes and rolls from Ian Rodgers the baker in St.Andrews. Most of the people who come to the shop are passers-by and elderly people. The purpose of having the shop is so people dont have to go far when they want groceries. Julie Nicol Talya Barry
